snippet: Police Commissioner Edward Davis said that had his department learned about the Russian tip on Tamerlan Tsarnaev, “we would certainly look at the individual.”
abstract: Boston Police Commissioner Edward Davis, during first public Congressional hearing on Boston Marathon bombings, says Federal Bureau of Investigation did not tell Boston police of 2011 warning from Russia about bombing suspect Tamerlan Tsarnaev.

byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

lead_paragraph: Police Commissioner Edward Davis said that had his department learned about the Russian tip on Tamerlan Tsarnaev, “we would certainly look at the individual.”

headline.seo: Boston Police Weren’t Told F.B.I. Got Warning on Tsarnaev
headline.main: F.B.I. Did Not Tell Police in Boston of Russian Tip
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Did Not Tell Police In Boston of Russian Tip
